circumstances: The airplane departed Boston on a local flight to spot the R.M.S. Queen Mary which was inbound to New York. While circling low around the liner's stern, the airplane went out of control and crashed into the sea some 8 km east of Boston harbor. A passenger was killed and eight other occupants were rescued.
probable_cause: The cause of the accident was determined to be the powerful downdraft created at the stern of the ship as the ocean liner sped across the water.
